abstract: Sergey Brin used it to find his hotel in Davos. Eric Schmidt thinks it is going to bring in advertising dollars. Google is planning to challenge it with its own cellphone software. What is it? The iPhone.
snippet: Sergey Brin used it to find his hotel in Davos. Eric Schmidt thinks it is going to bring in advertising dollars. Google is planning to challenge it with its own cellphone software. What is it? The iPhone.
lead_paragraph: For a company that is busy building its own cellphone operating system, Google shared a lot of love for the iPhone on its earnings-related conference call today. The most heartwarming story came from Sergey Brin, the company’s co-president, who said that he uses an iPhone himself. He described the value of the My Location feature of Google Maps on the iPhone, which can figure out (more or less) where you are even though the iPhone can’t receive G.P.S. navigational signals.

headline.main: Sergey Brin’s iPhone Adventure in Davos

abstract: The deal would reshape the Internet consumer services business, where both companies have struggled to compete with Google.
snippet: The deal would reshape the Internet consumer services business, where both companies have struggled to compete with Google.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  Microsoft said Friday that it has made an offer to buy Yahoo for about $44.6 billion, or $31 a share, in a mix of cash and stock.

abstract: Google reported a 17 percent jump in profit and a 51 percent growth in revenue in the fourth quarter, falling shy of Wall Street’s expectations.
snippet: Google reported a 17 percent jump in profit and a 51 percent growth in revenue in the fourth quarter, falling shy of Wall Street’s expectations.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  Google said it has seen no effect from a slowing economy on its advertising business, as it reported a 17 percent jump in profit and a 51 percent growth in revenue in the fourth quarter.

headline.main: Ad Growth Still Strong, Google Says
headline.print_headline: Ad Growth Still Strong, Google Says

abstract: The deal would reshape the Internet consumer services business, where both companies have struggled to compete with Google.
snippet: The deal would reshape the Internet consumer services business, where both companies have struggled to compete with Google.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  In a bold move to counter Google’s online pre-eminence, Microsoft said Friday that it had made an unsolicited offer to buy Yahoo for about $44.6 billion in a mix of cash and stock.

byline.original: By Miguel Helft and Andrew Ross Sorkin
